Randy Hembrador
UX Designer

Footprint Collective

Making sustainability more sustainable

Background

Many want to help the environment, but few explicitly track and manage their personal carbon footprint regularly. Reasons for the discrepancy range from unfamiliarity with the concept to overwhelm from its complexity and potential pervasiveness.

Objective

Design a solution that helps users get familiar with their carbon footprint, and manage it in a way that’s sustainable in everyday life.

Image via the Sierra Club

Carbon Footprint

Our project operated on the understanding that

  • A “carbon footprint” is the measure of one’s carbon emissions based on their activities and lifestyle choices
  • Footprints can be measured for anything from a person to a planet
  • Lifestyle choices can be changed to reduce one's carbon footprint and overall negative impact on the environment
Image source: co2living.com
